nodes.text: An e-nursery retail website that integrates clustering-based recommendation and visual data representation will improve user experience and optimize business operations for plant nurseries and customers
Using clustering algorithms (e.g., K-means, hierarchical clustering) can group users with similar preferences and behaviors to generate personalized product recommendations
Visual data representation (dashboards, charts) provides stakeholders and users with intuitive insights into sales trends, customer demographics, and product popularity to support decision-making
The platform design includes a catalog of plant species with descriptions, care guides, reviews, shopping cart, secure payment gateway, and user account management

Data sources for the system comprise a plant database (attributes and pricing), customer information (registrations, demographics, purchase and search history), and product feedback (reviews and ratings)
Data preparation involves cleaning and preprocessing customer and transaction data before applying clustering to assign users to clusters used for recommendations
Recommendation generation uses cluster membership to suggest products aligned with cluster interests and users' prior purchases and searches
Related literature supports clustering and hybrid approaches for improving recommendation accuracy, addressing cold-start and data sparsity issues in e-commerce
Integrating Tableau or Matplotlib with the project database enables creation of interactive dashboards and graphical visualizations for exploration and stakeholder communication
The implemented website modules include login, registration, home page, product pages, add-to-cart, checkout, payment gateway integration, and payment receipt generation
A demonstration recommendation example shows that when a user added Piper Betel Maghal, the system recommended Aloe vera based on the personalization mechanism

The integration of clustering-based recommendations and visualizations is concluded to enhance browsing, decision-making, inventory management, marketing strategy, and overall business efficiency for an e-nursery platform
Assumption: Sufficient, accurate customer interaction and product data are available to train clustering models and produce meaningful recommendations
Limitation: The paper presents interface screenshots and system design but does not report quantitative evaluation metrics, user studies, or comparisons of recommendation accuracy
